cs.CC, cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.CG

Reasoning: The paper is about the analysis of Boolean functions, which is a fundamental topic in theoretical computer science. The paper also mentions applications in cryptography, learning theory, and social choice theory, which are all subfields of computer science. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CC (Computational Complexity), which is concerned with the study of the inherent difficulty of computational problems. Other likely sub-categories include cs.IT (Information Theory), cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics), and cs.CG (Computational Geometry), which are all relevant to the study of Boolean functions.
